    • Method Detail

      • authenticate

        public URI authenticate(AuthenticationRequest authenticationRequest,
               String requestJwt,
               javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest req,
               javax.ws.rs.core.UriBuilder contextUriBuilder)
        Description copied from interface: Authenticator

        Obtains the URI to the start of the authentication process. This must be the full URL including the necessary query parameters.

        The simplest way of doing this is to pass the "request" parameter that encodes the original authentication request. 

         return contextUriBuilder.path("login.jsp")
         .queryParam(OpenIdConnectKey.REQUEST, requestJwt)
         .build();

        Depending on some values on the authentication request such as "display" or "ui-locale" a different URI can be provided.

        Specified by:
        authenticate in interface Authenticator
        Parameters:
        authenticationRequest - authentication request
        requestJwt - the request encoded in a JWT
        req - servlet request
        contextUriBuilder - UriBuilder pointing to the context. The rest can be added on from there.
        Returns:

        public String authenticateClient(String clientId,
                        String clientSecret)
        Description copied from interface: ClientManager
        Checks if the client secret matches what is expected for the client ID.

      • isAuthenticated

        public boolean isAuthenticated(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest req)
        Checks if the user is authenticated.

        If there is no UI application state for the OP aside, this will return false to force the user to enter their credentials when accessing the provider.

        Specified by:
        isAuthenticated in interface Authenticator
        Parameters:
        req - servlet request
        Returns:
        true if the user is authenticated.

      • logout

        public URI logout(String nonce,
         IdToken idToken,
         String state,
         URI postLogoutRedirectUri,
         javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest req,
         javax.ws.rs.core.UriBuilder contextUriBuilder)
        Description copied from interface: Authenticator
        The resulting URI MUST NOT have any of the data provided as they should already be in the session with the exception of the "nonce" value. It should call "end/confirm" with the "nonce" value that was passed in.
        Specified by:
        logout in interface Authenticator
        Parameters:
        nonce - nonce that is generated by the OP and must match when confirming the logout.
        contextUriBuilder - context URI builder.
        Returns:

      • endSession

        public void endSession(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest req)
        Description copied from interface: Authenticator
        Performs any session cleanup. Please note that this MUST NOT call HttpSession.invalidate() as that is implicitly invoked.
        Specified by:
        endSession in interface Authenticator
